data.title: Gold Awaits PMI for Further Push!
data.text: Gold has seen an upturn this past week as prices bounce away from the $1800 level. The yellow metal could progress further with the latest PMI data from America in today's session.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: Bulls keep pushing after strong Chinese Services PMI
data.text: Gold price bulls have returned to action this week, helping the bright metal break out of a bearish trend that had dominated XAU/USD price action during February. What has been more impressive is that Gold has been able to rally despite US Treasury bond yields gathering strength, which usually supports the US Dollar and weighs on yield-less commodities.

data.title: Gold Futures: Room for extra upside
data.text: CME Group's flash data for gold futures markets noted traders increased their open interest positions by around 5.6K contracts on Thursday, reaching the third consecutive daily build. Volume, instead, shrank for the second straight session, this time by around 44.3K contracts.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD to make headway for another run higher on daily closing above 21-DMA
data.text: Gold price is regaining upside traction. Will XAU/USD buyers recapture critical 21-Daily Moving Average (DMA) resistance?

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD approaches $1,865 hurdle as key US catalysts loom – Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) appears well-set to print the first weekly gain in five as the metal buyers cheer a softer US Dollar. Adding strength to the bullion's latest rebound could be the retreat in the US Treasury bond yields from multi-day highs.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD juggles around $1,840 amid mixed market mood, US Services PMI in focus
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) is displaying back-and-forth moves around $1,840.00 in the Asian session after a gradual move from $1,830.00. The precious metal has turned sideways amid mix market mood.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eyes weekly gain as United States Treasury bond yields retreat
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) returns to the buyer's radar, after a brief absence the previous day, as the US Dollar traces a pullback in the key United States Treasury bond yields during early Friday. That said, the yellow metal approaches a weekly high while printing 0.18% intraday gains around $1,840 by the press time.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bulls and bears battle it out between key hourly levels
data.text: Gold price is holding in a bullish territory after climbing from the start of the week's low near $1,823 and reaching a high of $1,844. However, the yellow metal finished with a loss on Thursday, following three three-day winning streak, as strength in the U.S. dollar weighed.

data.title: Gold, Silver, Platinum – Gold Stays Strong Despite Rising Treasury Yields
data.text: Rising demand for safe-haven assets provides support to precious metals.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast – Gold Markets Continue to Stretch Toward the Upside
data.text: Gold markets have pulled back just a bit during the trading session on Thursday, only to find buyers underneath. That being said, the market is at a major inflection point.

data.title: Gold is an attractive asset for 2023 – SocGen
data.text: 2023 will be the beginning of the end for USD strength. Thus, strategists at Société Générale believe that Gold exposure is set to provide great returns.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU, XAG/USD Wrestle with Rates & USD Strength
data.text: Gold and silver prices are facing technical and fundamental headwinds as higher rate expectations and inflation continue to drive price action. What next for XAU and XAG?

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: Macro backdrop remains supportive for XAU/USD – ANZ
data.text: A rise in US Treasury yields and a strengthening USD weighed on Gold. However, the macro backdrop remains supportive for the yellow metal, strategists at ANZ Bank report.

data.title: XAU/USD Tests Resistance
data.text: Gold clawed back some losses as the dollar hit a speed bump. A pop above the immediate resistance of 1827 has prompted some sellers to take profit, alleviating the downward pressure.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD remains depressed near $1,830 area amid stronger US Dollar
data.text: Gold price comes under some selling pressure on Thursday and stalls this week's recovery move from the $1,805-$1,804 region, or its lowest level since December 23. The XAU/USD remains depressed around the $1,830 area through the early European session and for now, seems to have snapped a three-day winning streak to a one-week high touched on Wednesday.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast XAU/USD -Struggling as Investors Grapple with Rate Hike Pressures
data.text: Weighing on gold prices is a fresh set of economic data that signaled global interest rates would stay higher for longer than previously anticipated.

data.title: Gold Futures: Extra upside still on the table
data.text: Open interest in gold futures markets increased for the second session in a row on Wednesday, this time by around 4.7K contracts according to preliminary readings from CME Group. Volume, instead, resumed the downtrend and shrank by nearly 5K contracts.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD recovery fades below 21-DMA at $1,847
data.text: Gold price is back in the red for the first time in four trading days. XAU/USD sellers could extend control after rejection near 21-Daily Moving Average (DMA), FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta reports.

data.title: Gold Price Rally Might be Short-Lived With the 2-Year Treasury Yield Nearing 5%
data.text: Gold's rally might be short-lived as US economic data continues to show evidence that inflation might be stickier than previously thought. XAU/USD turns to jobless claims data next.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD drops towards 200-SMA retest as yields underpin US Dollar rebound
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) seesaws around the intraday low of $1,831 during the first loss-making day in four heading into the European session. In doing so, the precious metal justifies the firmer US Dollar and risk-off mood in the market amid a sluggish Thursday.
